isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - TWO SPEED AXLE SPEEDOMETER CIRCUIT - FAULT DETECTION MANAGEMENT

svcproc.title: FAULT DETECTION MANAGEMENT
svcproc.para: There are no ECM DIAGNOSTICS for the two speed circuits.

Refer to Figure 3.101
for the two speed axle input circuit diagram.

figure.caption: Figure 3.101 Two Speed Axle Circuit Diagram

para.emph: USE EST TO PERFORM THE FOLLOWING TEST

step1.para: Use EST to verify correct ECM programming including correct rear axle ratios (high and low)

step2.para: If programmed correctly go to step 2.
If programming is not correct, make necessary programming corrections.

step1.para: Use EST to monitor two speed switch while changing switch position several times.

step2.para: If switch does not function, go to step 3.
If switch functions properly go to step 4.

step1.para: Disconnect connector from ECM. With key ON and switch in LOW position, measure voltage to ground at circuit 93A. Battery voltage (12 ± 1.5 volts) should be present (Figure 3.101).

step2.para: If less than 10.5 v check connections, if 0 volts check for open/short to ground.
If battery voltage is present, replace the ECM.

step1.para: Refer to Service Manual Group 08 Instruments, and perform Speedometer Self Diagnostic Test.

step2.para: If the self test is not OK, follow the recommendations of the service manual.

If the self test is OK, road test the vehicle and have a passenger monitor vehicle speed using the EST. If the EST displays the correct speed replace the speedometer/tachometer unit. If the EST does not display the correct speed, replace the ECM.
